generif.text: Eukaryotic initiation factor 5A (eIF5A) (eIF-4D, eIF-5A) stimulates ribosomal peptidyltransferase activity, transport of HIV-1-mRNAs and binds exportins 1 and 4. Contains hypusine at lys 50. Human EIF5A1 and EIF5A2 encode two isoforms: eIF5AI and eIF5AII.
role in eukaryotic cell survival similar to that of the ubiquitous eIF5A-1
eIF-5A2 overexpression was significantly associated with the advanced stage of ovarian cancer.
Mutations in the human EIF5A2 gene are not common causes of infertility in man
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)

In clinical samples, the expression of PTMA was significantly higher in the minor effect group than in the major effect group (P = 0.004), but there were no significant differences in EIF5a2 expression between the two groups.

These findings suggest that overexpression of EIF-5A2 in colorectal carcinomas may be important in the acquisition of a metastatic phenotype and plays an important role in colorectal carcinoma development and progression.

Increased expression of EIF-5A2 in ovarian carcinoma may represent an acquired malignant phenotypic feature of tumor cells. Overexpression of EIF-5A2 is an independent molecular marker for shortened survival time of patients with ovarian carcinoma.
Overexpression of EIF-5A2 is an independent predictor of outcome in patients of urothelial carcinoma of the bladder treated with radical cystectomy.
protein expression of eIF-5A2 might be regulated not only by gene amplification, but also by other molecular mechanisms

EIF5A2 plays an important role in hepatocellular carcinoma invasion and metastasis by inducing epithelial-mesenchymal transition, as well as stimulating cytoskeleton rearrangement through activation of RhoA and Rac1.
EIF5A2 promotes colorectal carcinoma cell aggressiveness by upregulating MTA1 through C-myc to induce epithelial-mesenchymaltransition.
eIF-5A as well as the hypusine-forming enzymes deoxyhypusine synthase (DHS) and deoxyhypusine hydroxylase (DOHH) are highly overexpressed in glioblastoma patient sample
None of the latter died within 5 years in EIF5A2-negative staining group.
focus on updating current knowledge of the EIF5A2 gene in human cancers
It significantly inhibited activity of eIF5A2.
EIF5A2 elevated TGF-beta1 expression through STAT3 to induce epithelial-mesenchymal transition and promotes aggressiveness in bladder cancer.
Increased expression of eIF5A2 increases metastasis and angiogenesis in esophageal squamous cell carcinoma via the HIF1alpha-mediated signaling pathway.
eIF-5A2 plays an important role in doxorubicin chemoresistance in breast cancer cells.

Our findings indicate that EIF5A2 upregulation plays an important oncogenic role in gastric cancer. EIF5A2 may represent a new predictor for poor survival and is a potential therapeutic target for gastric cancer.
MiR-30b suppresses tumor migration and invasion by targeting EIF5A2 expression in gastric cancer cells.

Data suggest that eukaryotic translation initiation factor 5A2 (EIF5A2) inhibitors might be considered as combination therapy to enhance chemosensitivity in patients with esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (ESCC).

Data indicate that regulation of sonic hedgehog (SHh)-GLI family zinc finger 1 (Gli1) signals to migration of pancreatic cancer AsPC-1 Cells through mediating eukaryotic translation initiation factor 5A (EIF5A2) gene expression.

EIF5A2 overexpression may contribute to cancer progression and poor prognosis. Therefore, EIF5A2 could be a novel potential prognostic marker for Federation of Gynecology and Obstetrics (FIGO) stage I-II cervical cancer.
Data suggest that inhibition of eIF5A2 alters progression of the EMT to decrease the invasion and metastasis of HCC cells via ROS-related pathways.

The model had 92% sensitivity and 92% specificity. We obtained similar results in the independent validation cohort. AIB1 and EIF5A2 show promise for the noninvasive detection of bladder cancer. The model based on AIB1, EIF5A2, and NMP22 outperformed each of the three individual biomarkers for detecting Bladder cancer.
EIF5A2 as a direct and functional target of miR-203.
High EIF5A2 expression is associated with hepatocellular carcinoma.
the tumor suppressive role of miR-221-3p in MB cell proliferation at least in part via targeting EIF5A2
MicroRNA-383 inhibits doxorubicin resistance in hepatocellular carcinoma by targeting eukaryotic translation initiation factor 5A2.

In cohort of patients with upper urinary tract urothelial carcinoma EIF5A2 low expression group had significantly longer overall survival (OS) and progression-free survival (PFS) than the EIF5A2 high expression group. The high expression of EIF5A2 significantly predict poor OS and PFS in the subset patients. EIF5A2 was an independent prognostic factor for OS and PFS.
MicroRNA-33b regulates sensitivity to daunorubicin in acute myelocytic leukemia by regulating eukaryotic translation initiation factor 5A-2.
DHPS-dependent hypusination of eIF5A1/2 is necessary for TGFbeta/fibronectin-induced breast cancer metastasis and associates with prognostically unfavorable genomic alterations in TP53
MicroRNA-588 regulates migration capacity and invasiveness of renal cancer cells by targeting EIF5A2.
High EIF5A2 expression is associated with renal interstitial fibrosis.
Long non-coding RNA LINC00520 promotes the proliferation and metastasis of malignant melanoma by inducing the miR-125b-5p/EIF5A2 axis.
Knockdown of eukaryotic translation initiation factor 5A2 enhances the therapeutic efficiency of doxorubicin in hepatocellular carcinoma cells by triggering lethal autophagy.
Circ_0003998 enhances doxorubicin resistance in hepatocellular carcinoma by regulating miR-218-5p/EIF5A2 pathway.
EIF5A2 enhances stemness of epithelial ovarian cancer cells via a E2F1/KLF4 axis.
The deubiquitinating enzyme ATXN3 promotes the progression of anaplastic thyroid carcinoma by stabilizing EIF5A2.
HERC3 regulates epithelial-mesenchymal transition by directly ubiquitination degradation EIF5A2 and inhibits metastasis of colorectal cancer.
Eukaryotic Initiation Factor 5A2 Regulates Expression of Antiviral Genes.
EIF5A2 promotes proliferation and invasion of intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma cells.
EIF5A2 specifically regulates the transcription of aging-related genes in human neuroblastoma cells.
MicroRNA-577/EIF5A2 axis suppressed the proliferation of DDP-resistant nasopharyngeal carcinoma cells by blocking TGF-beta signaling pathway.
MiR-5189-3p Suppresses cell Proliferation, Invasion and Migration Through Targeting EIF5A2 in Laryngeal Squamous Cell Carcinoma.
EIF5A2 Promotes Doxorubicin Resistance in Bladder Cancer Cells through the TGF-beta Signaling Pathway.
microRNA-15a-5p suppresses hypoxia-induced tumor growth and chemoresistance in bladder cancer by binding to eIF5A2.
Long non-coding RNA RAD51-AS1 promotes the tumorigenesis of ovarian cancer by elevating EIF5A2 expression.

interpro.desc: Large ribosomal subunit protein uL2, domain 2
Translation elongation factor, IF5A, hypusine site

name: eukaryotic translation initiation factor 5A2

reactome.name: Gamma carboxylation, hypusinylation, hydroxylation, and arylsulfatase activation

wikipathways.name: Epithelial to mesenchymal transition in colorectal cancer

summary: Predicted to enable translation elongation factor activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of translational elongation. Located in intracellular membrane-bounded organelle. [provided by Alliance of Genome Resources, Apr 2022]
